page.title: 02RELIGION IN MOORSHOLM
page.content: The Chapel was built as a Primitive Methodist in 1876. It has a coke boiler in the centre with the stack suspended from the roof. The Women's Fellowship meets for a prayer meeting on Wednesdays pm. The Minister is in the Guisborough Circuit - Service on Sundays. The Norman style Church of England, built with local stone, is in the Boosbeck Parish. There is an open churchyard. Two Communions per week are held, one on Sunday. A pulley bell calls worshippers. The clock strikes hours and quarters. Both Church and Chapel have Sunday Schools and also support each other in fund raising events. Carol Singing and Harvest Supper are joint affairs. Other denominations do not worship in the village.
